Package com.example.appointment.controller

Class AddAppointmentController

java.lang.Object
com.example.appointment.controller.Controller
com.example.appointment.controller.AddAppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
AddListenerInterface, AppointmentDataInterface, ComboBoxListenerInterface, GetAppointmentsInterface, SQLControllerInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ModifyAppointmentController
public class AddAppointmentController extends Controller implements AppointmentDataInterface, AddListenerInterface, ComboBoxListenerInterface, GetAppointmentsInterface
A controller that loads the Add Appointment page allowing users to add new appointments to the database.

  • Field Details

    • appointmentId

      protected Integer appointmentId
      The ID for this appointment. The value is always last ID value in the database +1.

    • appointmentStartDate

      protected LocalDate appointmentStartDate
      The start date for this appointment. The value is selected by the user using a DatePicker.

    • appointmentEndDate

      protected LocalDate appointmentEndDate
      The end date for this appointment. The value is selected automatically depending on the start date and time.

    • ZonedBusinessStartTime

      protected ZonedDateTime ZonedBusinessStartTime
      The business start time. Always 0800 of the day the user selects using the DatePicker.

    • ZonedBusinessEndTime

      protected ZonedDateTime ZonedBusinessEndTime
      The business end time. Always 2200 of the day the user selects using the DatePicker.

    • businessZoneId

      protected ZoneId businessZoneId
      The ZoneID for the business time. Set to Eastern Standard Time.

  • Constructor Details

    • AddAppointmentController

      public AddAppointmentController()

  • Method Details

    • setAppointmentId

      protected void setAppointmentId() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that retrieves the appointment ID value from the database. The user does not set the appointment ID, it is generated automatically by the program so that if they are 25 items in the database the next item will be #26.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setAppointmentController

      public void setAppointmentController() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that sets up the TextFields for the controller. This is necessary so that each method doesn't have to be called individually.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • setContactIdComboBox

      protected void setContactIdComboBox() throws SQLException, IOException
      A method that loads the contact ID ComboBox with values from the database. After the ComboBox gets it values from the setComboBoxValidation method it sorts the values in numerical order.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • setCustomerIdComboBox

      protected void setCustomerIdComboBox() throws SQLException, IOException
      A method that loads the customer ID ComboBox with values from the database. After the ComboBox gets it values from the setComboBoxValidation method it sorts the values in numerical order.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • setUserIdComboBox

      protected void setUserIdComboBox() throws SQLException, IOException
      A method that loads the user ID ComboBox with values from the database. After the ComboBox gets it values from the setComboBoxValidation method it sorts the values in numerical order.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • setAppointmentStartDatePicker

      protected void setAppointmentStartDatePicker()
      This method restricts the Start Date DatePicker so that you cannot select dates before the current day.
      Lambda Expression
      It works by calling the date picker method setDayCellFactory which can take in a lambda expression to override the individual date cell's updateItem method. This allows to you customize an action for each individual cell. I used it to set that all dates before the current date will be disabled. This is done by using LocalDate's compareTo method that returns an integer value based on the comparison.

    • setHourTimeSpinner

      protected void setHourTimeSpinner()
      A method that loads the values for the hour time spinners for the start time, and end time. Both are editable, and the values are checked for validity upon saving the appointment.

    • setMinuteTimeSpinner

      protected void setMinuteTimeSpinner()
      A method that loads the values for the minute time spinners for the start time, and end time. Both are editable, and the values are checked for validity upon saving the appointment.

    • setBusinessTimes

      protected void setBusinessTimes()
      A method that sets up the business hours for the start time and end time values to be checked against. Regular business hours are from 0800 to 2200 Eastern Standard Time.

    • saveAppointment

      public void saveAppointment(ActionEvent event) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that saves the appointment that was created in the controller to the database.
      Verifying TextFields
      The first thing the method does is verify data from the TextFields.
      These include:
      1. Title
      2. Description
      3. Location
      4. Type

      These are verified by making sure that their respective TextFields are no empty. If they are the error flag is set to true, and a listener is added to the TextField.
      Next, the date information is checked to make sure they are within range of the business time of 0800-2200 EST. The method also sets the end date DatePicker based on the time entered in for the start date. If the ending hour is greater than or equal to the starting hour, then the end date DatePicker will be set to the same day, if it's less than the start date hour then it will end on the next day.
      After the date has been verified the method checks the data in the ComboBoxes.
      These include:
      1. Contact ID
      2. Customer ID
      3. User ID

      If the values are not null, then the method goes on to the next step.
      After the data has been validated then an appointment object will be created that will get passed into the add appointment method where it will get added to the database.
      Parameters:
      event - Passes in that the save button was pressed.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • addAppointment

      public void addAppointment(Appointment appointment) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that takes an Appointment object that is created in the saveAppointment() method and then passes the object into the database. After the object has been successfully added to the database it shows an alert message to the user.
      Parameters:
      appointment - A passed in appointment to be added to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If a SQL error occurs that disrupts the connection to the database.

    • appointmentOverlapAlert

      public void appointmentOverlapAlert(List<Appointment> appointments)
      A method that creates an alert message that tells the user if that has appointments that overlap.
      Parameters:
      appointments - A list of overlapping appointments to add to the alert.

    • isAppointmentOverlapping

      public List<Appointment> isAppointmentOverlapping(int contactId, ZonedDateTime userAppointmentStartDate, ZonedDateTime userAppointmentEndDate) throws IOException, SQLException
      A method that returns a list of appointments that are overlapping. This list can be used to create an alert using the appointment overlap method. Authors Note
      This method and was surprisingly difficult to design. When I first made it the appointment times were all wrong because they weren't changing time with the time zones. I figured out to get it to properly work I had to convert the local times to Instant, and then to ZonedDateTimes to be compared.
      Parameters:
      contactId - The contact ID of the user whose appointments that need to be checked.
      userAppointmentStartDate - The start date and time that the user has entered into the program that will be checked to see if it's overlapping.
      userAppointmentEndDate - The end date and time that the user has entered into the program that will be checked to see if it's overlapping.
      Returns:
      A list of appointments that are overlapping.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.
      SQLException - If a SQL database error occurs.

    • changeSceneToMainController

      public void changeSceneToMainController(ActionEvent event)
      This appointment is overridden so that if a new appointment is added it will check again to see if the appointment is within fifteen minutes of the current time.
      Overrides:
      changeSceneToMainController in class Controller
      Parameters:
      event - Takes in that a button was pressed.
      See Also:
      • Controller.changeSceneToMainController(ActionEvent)
